title: How to Get Connected to Xbox Live

steps.headline: Connect your Xbox 360 to your router or modem using an Ethernet network cable.
steps.description: You will need to purchase the network cable separately from the console.

steps.headline: Press the Guide button to open the Xbox 360 menu.
steps.description: The Guide button is the center button on your Xbox 360 controller.

steps.headline: Select "Wired Network" from the list of available connection types.
Select "Test Xbox Live Connection".
steps.description: If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates.

steps.headline: Troubleshoot a faulty connection.
steps.description: Click here for troubleshooting tips.

steps.headline: Connect an Xbox 360 wireless adapter to your Xbox 360 (Original model only).
steps.description: The original Xbox 360 does not have a built-in wireless adapter, so you will need to install a USB wireless adapter to the back of the Xbox. This will have to be purchased separately. The adapter plugs into the USB port on the back of your Xbox 360.

steps.headline: Press the Guide button to open the Xbox 360 menu.
steps.description: The Guide button is the center button on your Xbox 360 controller.

steps.headline: Select "Wireless Network" from the list of available connection types.
Select your wireless network from the list of detected networks.
steps.description: Your wireless network name (SSID) will be listed if your Xbox 360 can detect the signal. If you can't see your wireless network in the list, check to ensure that your Xbox 360 is close enough to receive the signal. If you still can't see your network, your router may not be properly configured. Click here for instructions on troubleshooting your wireless router.

steps.headline: Enter your wireless network password.
steps.description: Most wireless networks are secured, and require a password to connect. If you don't know the password, ask the person in charge of your network. If you forgot your network password, click here for some tips on retrieving it.

steps.headline: Select "Test Xbox Live Connection".
steps.description: If you can successfully connect, your connection is properly configured. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates.

steps.headline: Troubleshoot a faulty connection.
steps.description: Click here for troubleshooting tips.

steps.headline: Connect your Xbox One to your router or modem using an Ethernet network cable.
steps.description: You will need to purchase the network cable separately from the console.

steps.headline: Press the "Menu" button on your Xbox One controller.
Select "Test network connection".
steps.description: If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates.

steps.headline: Troubleshoot a faulty connection.
steps.description: Click here for troubleshooting tips.

steps.headline: Turn your Xbox One on.
steps.description: All Xbox Ones have wireless adapters built-in.

steps.headline: Press the "Menu" button on your Xbox One controller.
Select your wireless network from the list of available networks.
Enter your wireless network password.
steps.description: Most wireless networks are secured, and require a password to connect. If you don't know the password, ask the person in charge of your network. If you forgot your network password, click here for some tips on retrieving it.

steps.headline: Select "Test network connection".
steps.description: If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates.

steps.headline: Check that the Xbox Live services are online.
steps.description: You can use the Xbox Live Status page from the Xbox Support site to see if the service sis functioning properly on Microsoft's end.

steps.headline: Check your network connection from another device.
steps.description: If your other devices or computers cannot connect to the internet, then the problem may lie in your router or with your ISP. If none of your devices can connect to the internet, try unplugging the power cables for your router and/or modem for 30 seconds, and then plug them back in.

steps.headline: Plug your network cable into a different jack (wired only).
steps.description: If you're using a wired connection and connecting to a router, try plugging your network cable into a different jack on the router.

steps.headline: Try a different network cable.
steps.description: If the cable is old, it may have frayed. Try using a different cable to see if your connection problems are solved.

text: Xbox 360 Connect your Xbox 360 to your router or modem using an Ethernet network cable. You will need to purchase the network cable separately from the console. Turn the Xbox 360 on.  Press the Guide button to open the Xbox 360 menu. The Guide button is the center button on your Xbox 360 controller. Select the "Settings" tab.  Select "System Settings".  Select "Network Settings".  Select "Wired Network" from the list of available connection types.  Select "Test Xbox Live Connection". If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates. Troubleshoot a faulty connection. Click here for troubleshooting tips. Connect an Xbox 360 wireless adapter to your Xbox 360 (Original model only). The original Xbox 360 does not have a built-in wireless adapter, so you will need to install a USB wireless adapter to the back of the Xbox. This will have to be purchased separately. The adapter plugs into the USB port on the back of your Xbox 360. Turn on your Xbox 360.  Press the Guide button to open the Xbox 360 menu. The Guide button is the center button on your Xbox 360 controller. Select the "Settings" tab.  Select "System Settings".  Select "Network Settings".  Select "Wireless Network" from the list of available connection types.  Select your wireless network from the list of detected networks. Your wireless network name (SSID) will be listed if your Xbox 360 can detect the signal. If you can't see your wireless network in the list, check to ensure that your Xbox 360 is close enough to receive the signal. If you still can't see your network, your router may not be properly configured. Click here for instructions on troubleshooting your wireless router. Enter your wireless network password. Most wireless networks are secured, and require a password to connect. If you don't know the password, ask the person in charge of your network. If you forgot your network password, click here for some tips on retrieving it. Select "Test Xbox Live Connection". If you can successfully connect, your connection is properly configured. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates. Troubleshoot a faulty connection. Click here for troubleshooting tips. Xbox One Connect your Xbox One to your router or modem using an Ethernet network cable. You will need to purchase the network cable separately from the console. Turn your Xbox One on.  Press the "Menu" button on your Xbox One controller.  Select the "Settings" tab.  Select "Network".  Select "Test network connection". If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates. Troubleshoot a faulty connection. Click here for troubleshooting tips. Turn your Xbox One on. All Xbox Ones have wireless adapters built-in. Press the "Menu" button on your Xbox One controller.  Select the "Settings" tab.  Select "Network".  Select "Setup wireless network".  Select your wireless network from the list of available networks.  Enter your wireless network password. Most wireless networks are secured, and require a password to connect. If you don't know the password, ask the person in charge of your network. If you forgot your network password, click here for some tips on retrieving it. Select "Test network connection". If the test is successful, then your Xbox is able to connect to Xbox Live. You will need to create an account and sign in to take advantage of the Xbox Live network features. You may be prompted to download any available updates. Troubleshooting a Faulty Connection Check that the Xbox Live services are online. You can use the Xbox Live Status page from the Xbox Support site to see if the service sis functioning properly on Microsoft's end. Check your network connection from another device. If your other devices or computers cannot connect to the internet, then the problem may lie in your router or with your ISP. If none of your devices can connect to the internet, try unplugging the power cables for your router and/or modem for 30 seconds, and then plug them back in. Plug your network cable into a different jack (wired only). If you're using a wired connection and connecting to a router, try plugging your network cable into a different jack on the router. Try a different network cable. If the cable is old, it may have frayed. Try using a different cable to see if your connection problems are solved.
